name: Eric Evans
background: Author of Domain-Driven Design: Tackling Complexity in the Heart of Software. Creator of DDD methodology. Consultant focused on complex domain modeling.

principles.name: Aggregate Design
principles.description: Cluster entities and value objects into aggregates with a single root. Enforce invariants within aggregate boundaries. Keep aggregates small.
principles.falsification: When aggregate design leads to worse outcomes than alternatives

principles.name: Bounded Context
principles.description: Explicitly define the boundaries within which a model applies. Different contexts can have different models for the same concept. Don't force a single unified model.
principles.falsification: When bounded context leads to worse outcomes than alternatives

principles.name: Context Mapping
principles.description: Explicitly map how bounded contexts relate: shared kernel, customer-supplier, conformist, anticorruption layer. Choose integration patterns deliberately.
principles.falsification: When context mapping leads to worse outcomes than alternatives

principles.name: Core vs Context
principles.description: Distinguish core business logic from supporting context. Invest accordingly.
principles.falsification: When core vs context leads to worse outcomes than alternatives
